passages.text: Industrials | Machinery

SPOKE WITH CAT MGMT; 8K Notes Incremental \(\) 250m\(Of Tariff Drag; Metals Inclusion Tariffs The Main Culprit, No Chg To Revs, \~\) 0.40 EPS Impact, We Tweak Est Dn \(\) 0.33\(Assuming Incremental Mitigation

CAT filed its 8K at \(4:45\mathrm{pm}\) eastern noting previous tariff impact for \(^{\ast}25\) \((\) 1.3b- \(\) 1.5b\(is now\) \ \(1.5b- \)\ \(1.8b\) the incremental \(\) 250m\(using midpts\) \sim 0.40 \(EPS (for perspective,\) 25 EPS consensus \(\) 18.43\(, CAT does not provide EPS guide).

Of the incremental \(\) 250m\(,\) \ \(100m\) in 3Q (we calc as \(\sim\) 0.16 EPS), \(\) 150m\(in 4Q,(\sim\) 0.24 EPS) from previous tariff guide. No change to rev guide but mgn guide for full yr now "near bottom of tgt range" vs previous "in the bottom half of tgt range" What's new to change tariff impact guide provided 23 days ago? It's what I noted in our PRM noted yesterday Trump Admin expanding sharply scope of steel/alum tariffs with metals inclusion impacting imported machines/components (CAT excavators from Japan/China, articulated dump trucks from UK, components such as CAT truck bodies from Mexico, etc.). The India reciprocal rate enacted yesterday also an incremental drag but main change is metals inclusion within past 1- 2 weeks. No notable mitigating factors taken to address these higher tariffs in the incremental \(\) 250m\(but CAT can/is considering some mitigating factors (as per my prior fieldwork, note word in channel CAT considering reducing price discounts, some already enacted such as article trucks) with CAT noting today "all options for mitigation are under consideration".

That said, CAT still willing to call out this incremental \(\) 250m\(, at face value, suggests they are unlikely able to offset this full amount by year end, at a minimum as, if they could, why bother to file this 8K.

End of the day, disappointing but not a game changer; took the incremental positive of my hearing in channel CAT starting to reduce discounting to now a necessity. Doesn't change upward trajectory (red to black) in y- o- y revs for 2H25 & rev momentum into '26 (current stronger orders & lrg backlog) but will put more sensitivity to elasticity of demand assuming less discounting & what's the op leverage in '26 on higher revs?

Assuming SOME mitigation of \(\) 250m\(, tweaking our'25 EPS est from\) \ \(18.78\) to \(\) 18.45\(, maintaining'26 EPS est\) \ \(22.86\) , stk \(19x\) '26 EPS still attractive but we'll have to monitor broader impacts on entire Machinery sector as well (CAT impact likely not in isolation).

Our price target for Caterpillar (Outperform) is \(476. The methodology that we use to calculate target prices for all of our stocks is averaging derived target prices from EV- to- sales, EV- to- EBITDA and P/E calculations based on our 2026 base valuation year sales, EPS and EBITDA estimates. Our target P/E multiple is 21x, our EV- to- Sales multiple is 3.25x and our EV- to- EBITDA multiple is 15x.

We view the risks to the company's ability to reach our target price as the following: in addition to overall market risk, companies in the Machinery sector generally have high operating leverage and participate in cyclical industries. Risks to our Sales, EBITDA and EPS estimates remain closely aligned with the pace of economic growth.

Caterpillar designs, manufactures and markets construction, mining and forestry machinery as well as a broad array of engines and turbines. The company also offers financing and insurance. Equipment sales are reported in four businesses, Construction Industries (41% of 2024 sales), Resource Industries (20% of 2024 sales), Energy & Transportation (39% of 2024 sales) and All Other (0.2% of 2024 sales). Geographically in 2024, equipment sales were 52% in North America, 20% Europe, Africa & Middle East, 18% Asia Pacific, and 11% Latin America. CAT Financial Products represented 7% of total company 2024 profits.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Time of dissemination: August 28 2025 6:34 PM ET

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:

Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. In Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector. Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances. Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, In Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
